cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 mi WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, forecast to turn northeast, cross the Florida Big Bend tonight, then accelerate northeastward just offshore of the Southeast U.S. coast and out into the west-central Atlantic
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: 0 (system remains offshore relative to New York, NY & NJ)
cyclone.hours_of_strike: 0 (no direct strike expected at the port)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watch in effect north of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings from Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL on the Gulf coast and Sebastian Inlet FL to South Santee River SC on the Atlantic coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, northern Florida, Georgia and the coastal Carolinas, then offshore Atlantic waters
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: 2016-06-08 (Wednesday) while well offshore to the south-southeast
weather_observation.expected_leaving_port_date: 2016-06-09 (Thursday) as it accelerates east-northeast into the open Atlantic
weather_observation.first_hazard: None expected at port (system stays well offshore)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty easterly breezes possible mid-week as the storm passes far offshore, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely
weather_observation.rainfall: Light outer-band showers possible; heavy rainfall not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along New Jersey and Long Island beaches mid-week
